comments.body: See yourself, here see in the EXPLANATION section on the right top corner
Just have a look at the explanation of regex101.com: regex101.com/r/jX2vD8/1
Which part of it do you find confusing?

answers.body:
/? matches the character / literally

(?:\?.*)? Non-capturing group

\? matches the character ? literally

.* matches any character (except newline)

$ assert position at end of the string

title: what this regular expression mean '/\/?(?:\?.*)?$/'
body:
I could not understand the following code:

var req = "google.com/?x=value&y=another";
req = req.replace(/\/?(?:\?.*)?$/, '');
console.log(req);

The above code prints google.com, its removing the query parameters from the string.

can anyone explain me how the replace function doing this task?
